verse.roman:
siddhir bhagasya bhāryāṅga
mahimānaṁ vibhuṁ prabhum
āśiṣaṁ ca varārohāṁ
kanyāṁ prāsūta suvratām

synonyms: siddhiḥ—Siddhi; bhagasya—of Bhaga; bhāryā—the wife; aṅga—my dear King; mahimānam—Mahimā; vibhum—Vibhu; prabhum—Prabhu; āśiṣam—Āśī; ca—and; varārohām—very beautiful; kanyām—daughter; prāsūta—bore; su-vratām—virtuous.
translation: O King, Siddhi, who was the wife of Bhaga, the sixth son of Aditi, bore three sons, named Mahimā, Vibhu and Prabhu, and one extremely beautiful daughter, whose name was Āśī.
